name: Japan
funFact: Japan consists of over 6,800 islands, with four main islands making up most of its land area.

name: Australia
funFact: Australia is the only country that is also a continent, and it's the world's largest island.

name: Italy
funFact: Italy has more UNESCO World Heritage sites than any other country in the world.

name: Brazil
funFact: Brazil is the fifth largest country in the world by both area and population.

name: United States
funFact: The United States is the third largest country by both land area and population.

name: India
funFact: India has the world's largest democracy and is the birthplace of four major religions.

name: France
funFact: France is the most visited country in the world, with over 89 million tourists annually.

name: Egypt
hints: The Nile River flows through it
funFact: Egypt is home to one of the world's oldest civilizations, dating back to around 3100 BCE.

name: Mexico
hints: Located south of the United States
funFact: Mexico introduced chocolate, corn, and chilies to the world, and its cuisine is UNESCO-recognized.

name: South Africa
hints: Located at the southern tip of Africa
funFact: South Africa is the only country in the world with three capital cities: Pretoria, Cape Town, and Bloemfontein.

name: Germany
hints: Known for its engineering and automotive industry
funFact: Germany has over 1,500 different types of sausages and 1,300 beer breweries with more than 7,000 different types of beer.

name: Canada
hints: Known for maple syrup and hockey
funFact: Canada has the longest coastline of any country in the world, stretching over 202,080 kilometers.

name: China
hints: Most populous country in the world
funFact: China is home to the world's largest palace complex, the Forbidden City, which contains 9,999 rooms.

name: Russia
funFact: Russia is so large that it spans 11 time zones and borders 14 different countries.

name: Spain
hints: Known for flamenco dancing and bullfighting
funFact: Spain is the world's largest producer of olive oil, accounting for nearly half of global production.

name: Argentina
funFact: Argentina is home to both the highest and lowest points in the Southern Hemisphere.

name: United Kingdom
funFact: The United Kingdom is made up of four countries: England, Scotland, Wales, and Northern Ireland.

name: South Korea
funFact: South Korea has the fastest average internet connection speed in the world.

name: Sweden
funFact: Sweden has the most islands of any country in the world, with over 267,570 islands.

name: Thailand
hints: Known for its beaches and temples
funFact: Thailand is the only Southeast Asian country that was never colonized by a European power.

name: Turkey
hints: Known for kebabs and Turkish delight
funFact: Turkey is home to one of the world's oldest continuously inhabited cities, Konya, dating back to 7,000 BCE.

name: New Zealand
hints: Known for kiwi birds and Lord of the Rings
funFact: New Zealand was the first country to give women the right to vote in 1893.

name: Nigeria
funFact: Nigeria has over 250 ethnic groups and 500 languages, making it one of the most diverse countries in the world.

name: Saudi Arabia
funFact: Saudi Arabia is the largest country in the world without a river.

name: Poland
funFact: Poland is home to the world's largest castle by land area, Malbork Castle.

name: Netherlands
funFact: The Netherlands has more bicycles than people, with an estimated 22.5 million bikes for 17 million residents.

name: Greece
hints: Known for ancient ruins and mythology
funFact: Greece has more archaeological museums than any other country in the world.

name: Vietnam
funFact: Vietnam is the world's largest exporter of cashew nuts and black pepper.

name: Chile
hints: Long, narrow country in South America
funFact: Chile is the world's longest country from north to south, stretching over 4,300 kilometers.

name: Portugal
hints: Known for port wine and fado music
funFact: Portugal is home to the world's oldest bookstore, Livraria Bertrand, established in 1732.

name: Switzerland
funFact: Switzerland has the world's longest passenger tunnel, the Gotthard Base Tunnel, which is 57 km long.

name: Morocco
hints: Known for its markets and Sahara Desert
funFact: Morocco is home to the oldest university in the world, University of Al-Qarawiyyin, founded in 859 CE.

name: Ireland
hints: Known for St. Patrick's Day and Guinness
funFact: Ireland has more Nobel Prize winners for literature than any other country in the world per capita.

name: Peru
funFact: Peru has the highest sand dune in the world, Cerro Blanco, which is 3,860 feet tall.

name: Eswatini
hints: One of the last absolute monarchies
funFact: Eswatini is one of the few remaining absolute monarchies in the world and the only one in Africa.

name: Comoros
hints: Island nation in the Indian Ocean
funFact: Comoros is the third-smallest African nation by area and is known as the 'Perfume Islands' for its fragrant plant exports.

name: Djibouti
hints: Located in the Horn of Africa
Bordered by Eritrea, Ethiopia, and Somalia
funFact: Djibouti is home to Lake Assal, the lowest point in Africa and the third-lowest point on Earth at 155 meters below sea level.

name: Kiribati
hints: Island nation in the central Pacific Ocean
Consists of 32 atolls and one raised coral island
funFact: Kiribati is the only country in the world to be situated in all four hemispheres (North, South, East, and West).

name: Timor-Leste
hints: Occupies the eastern half of Timor island
funFact: Timor-Leste is one of the world's youngest countries, gaining independence in 2002 after 24 years of Indonesian occupation.

name: Suriname
hints: Located on the northeastern coast of South America
Only Dutch-speaking country in South America
funFact: Suriname is one of the most ethnically diverse countries in the Americas, with populations of Dutch, Indian, African, Indonesian, and indigenous descent.

name: São Tomé and Príncipe
hints: Island nation in the Gulf of Guinea
funFact: São Tomé and Príncipe is Africa's second-smallest country and was once the world's largest producer of cocoa.

name: Vanuatu
hints: Island nation in the South Pacific
funFact: Vanuatu is considered one of the happiest countries in the world despite having little material wealth, and is home to the original bungee jumping ritual.

name: Tuvalu
hints: Island nation in the Pacific Ocean
funFact: Tuvalu is the least visited country in the world, with only about 2,000 tourists annually, and may be the first nation to disappear due to rising sea levels.

name: Brunei
hints: Located on the island of Borneo
funFact: Brunei's Istana Nurul Iman is the world's largest residential palace, with 1,788 rooms and a total area of 2.2 million square feet.

name: Bhutan
hints: Landlocked country in the Eastern Himalayas
Known as the 'Land of the Thunder Dragon'
funFact: Bhutan measures prosperity by Gross National Happiness instead of GDP and is the only carbon-negative country in the world.

name: Moldova
funFact: Moldova has the world's largest wine cellar at Mileștii Mici, with over 200 km of underground galleries and 2 million bottles.

name: Guyana
hints: Located on the northern coast of South America
Only English-speaking country in South America
funFact: Guyana is home to Kaieteur Falls, the world's largest single-drop waterfall by volume, which is five times higher than Niagara Falls.

name: Seychelles
hints: Island nation in the Indian Ocean
funFact: Seychelles is home to the Coco de Mer palm, which produces the largest and heaviest seed in the plant kingdom, weighing up to 30 kg.

name: Mauritius
hints: Island nation in the Indian Ocean
funFact: Mauritius was the only known habitat of the dodo bird before it went extinct in the 17th century due to human activity.

name: Cabo Verde
hints: Island nation in the Atlantic Ocean
Located off the west coast of Africa
funFact: Cabo Verde has more citizens living abroad than within the country itself, with its diaspora population primarily in the United States and Portugal.

name: Belize
hints: Located on the eastern coast of Central America
Only English-speaking country in Central America
funFact: Belize is home to the Great Blue Hole, a giant marine sinkhole that is over 300 meters across and 125 meters deep.

name: Andorra
hints: Landlocked microstate in the Pyrenees mountains
funFact: Andorra has the highest life expectancy in the world at 82.9 years, and has no army of its own, with defense provided by France and Spain.

name: Monaco
hints: Known for its casino and Formula 1 race
funFact: Monaco is so small that it could fit inside New York's Central Park more than 3 times, yet it has the highest number of millionaires and billionaires per capita in the world.

name: Palau
hints: Island country in the western Pacific
funFact: Palau was the first country in the world to ban sunscreen that is harmful to coral reefs, and its Jellyfish Lake contains millions of golden jellyfish that have lost their sting.
